block.p: ARCHER DANIELS MIDLAND CO., Decatur, Ill., the grain processor, said it had increased its stake in a German grain trader, Toepfer International, to 80 percent from 75 percent. Terms were not disclosed.

BOEING CO., Chicago, the airplane maker, said that it had signed a $400 million contract with the U.S. government to upgrade 35 AH-64A Apache helicopters to next-generation AH-64D Apaches for the Egyptian Army. Delivery is scheduled to begin in 2003.

BOEING CO., Chicago, the airplane maker, said that it had signed a $400 million contract with the U.S. government to upgrade 35 AH-64A Apache helicopters to next-generation AH-64D Apaches for the Egyptian Army. Delivery is scheduled to begin in 2003.

BALLARD POWER SYSTEMS INC., Burnaby, Canada, a maker of proton exchange membrane fuel cells, said it had won a three-year $43.8 million contract to provide fuel-cell engines and support services to Ford Motor Co., Dearborn, Mich., which plans to introduce a commercial fuel-cell vehicle by 2004.

MCSI INC., Dayton, Ohio, a maker and integrator of computer, audiovisual and broadcast equipment, said it would eliminate more than 100 jobs and sell its Canadian computer products business to focus on its integration services. Terms and the buyer were not disclosed.
